**Orion**, @, is the [Ranger](/wiki/Ranger "Ranger") [quest leader](/wiki/Quest_leader "Quest leader"). He is a [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong"), [omnivorous](/wiki/Omnivorous "Omnivorous") [human](/wiki/Human_\(monster_attribute\) "Human (monster attribute)") that possesses [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"), can be seen via infravision, can [see invisible](/wiki/See_invisible "See invisible"), and is [amphibious](/wiki/Amphibious "Amphibious") and capable of [swimming](/wiki/Swimming "Swimming").

Orion has a single weapon attack.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Per [commit 20cbadcf](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/20cbadcf85544cf9d0c3f4e4200b2800bab49c8e), killing quest leaders no longer makes the game [unwinnable](/wiki/Unwinnable "Unwinnable"), and Orion and other quest leaders are given stat buffs and additional equipment to compensate. Orion's [speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed") is increased to 15, his [MR score](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)") becomes 90, and he has a 4d10 weapon attack and will attempt one 4d8 mage [monster spell](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell") during each of his turns.

- [5 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

## Generation

Orion is generated within his camp, the [Ranger quest](/wiki/Ranger_quest "Ranger quest") home level, and stands on the central square of the grove section.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

As part of [commit 20cbadcf](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/20cbadcf85544cf9d0c3f4e4200b2800bab49c8e), Orion [always generates with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") +5 [leather armor](/wiki/Leather_armor "Leather armor"), a +4 [yumi](/wiki/Yumi "Yumi"), and 50 +4 [arrows](/wiki/Arrow "Arrow").

## History

Orion first appears with the Ranger role and quest in [NetHack 3.3.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.3.0 "NetHack 3.3.0").

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Orion (mythology)](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orion_\(mythology\) "wikipedia:Orion (mythology)")***

In classical mythology, Orion (Ancient Greek *Ὠρίων* or *Ὠαρίων*, Latin "Orion") was a giant huntsman with several different stories about him throughout the folklore - there are two major versions of his birth and several versions of his death. One etiological passage which says that Orion was responsible for the present shape of the Strait of Sicily, and another has Orion swimming in an ocean before the scorpion who would become the constellation [Scorpius](/wiki/Scorpius "Scorpius") (whose size varies with the telling) was sent after him - this is why he is capable of swimming in *NetHack*, though very few if any players will witness this in practice.

The most important recorded episodes are his birth in Boeotia, his visit to Chios where a drunken Orion slept with or assaulted Merope, was blinded by Merope's father Oenopion, and recovered his sight at Lemnos. According to one version among these episodes, Orion boasted to the goddess Artemis and her mother Leto while hunting with them that he could kill every animal that was of the Earth, and the duo sent a scorpion to kill Orion; their battle caught the attention of Zeus, who raised both combatants to the sky to serve as a reminder for mortals to curb their excessive pride. In another version, Artemis's twin brother Apollo sent the scorpion to kill Orion after the hunter earned the goddess's favor by admitting she was better than him, after which Zeus raised Orion and the scorpion to the sky. The seasons for each constellation's appearance is explained as Orion resuming his hunts every winter, but fleeing every summer when the scorpion comes.

## Variants

Some variants make Orion and other quest leaders stronger to accommodate changes to the Quest and its entry mechanics, and these changes may be incorporated into upcoming versions of *NetHack* or else be borrowed from them.

### SporkHack

In [SporkHack](/wiki/SporkHack "SporkHack"), Orion has his [difficulty](/wiki/Monster_difficulty "Monster difficulty") increased to 24. Orion's [speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed") is increased to 15, his [MR score](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)") becomes 90, and he has a 4d10 weapon attack and will attempt one 4d8 mage [monster spell](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell") during each of his turns. He also gains [flight](/wiki/Flight "Flight"), [sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance"), [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance") and [stoning resistance](/wiki/Stoning_resistance "Stoning resistance").

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), Orion has his effective base [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") changed to 7, and all 3 points are in the dodge category.

Orion [always generates with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") blessed +5 [elven boots](/wiki/Elven_boots "Elven boots"), blessed +5 [leather armor](/wiki/Leather_armor "Leather armor"), a blessed +7 [bow](/wiki/Bow "Bow") and 30 blessed +7 [silver arrows](/wiki/Silver_arrow "Silver arrow").

### xNetHack

In [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), Orion's stats are improved as in SporkHack, minus the flight and resistances.

### SpliceHack

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), Orion's stats are improved as in SporkHack minus the flight, difficulty and resistances.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), Orion's stats and resistances are improved as in SporkHack, minus the difficulty increase and flight.

Orion always generates with +4 [plain armor](/wiki/Leather_armor "Leather armor"), a +4 [yumi](/wiki/Yumi "Yumi"), and 50 +4 [arrows](/wiki/Arrow "Arrow"). If [The Longbow of Diana](/wiki/The_Longbow_of_Diana "The Longbow of Diana") or [The Crossbow of Carl](/wiki/The_Crossbow_of_Carl "The Crossbow of Carl") are successfully [wished](/wiki/Wish "Wish") for by a non-Ranger and the other artifact is not present in the game, there is a x⁄x+1 chance (where *x* is the amount of previous [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") wishes) of a hostile Orion generating adjacent to the character with the artifact in his possession. If one artifact is wished for with the other artifact already generated, a hostile [ranger](/wiki/Ranger_\(player_monster\) "Ranger (player monster)") [player monster](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster") will generate with the artifact instead.

All of the above information also applies to [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM").

## Encyclopedia entry

Orion was the son of Neptune. He was a handsome giant and  
a mighty hunter. His father gave him the power of wading  
through the depths of the sea, or, as others say, of  
walking on its surface.  
  
He dwelt as a hunter with Diana (Artemis), with whom he  
was a favourite, and it is even said she was about to marry  
him. Her brother was highly displeased and often chid her,  
but to no purpose. One day, observing Orion wading through  
the sea with his head just above the water, Apollo pointed  
it out to his sister and maintained that she could not hit  
that black thing on the sea. The archer-goddess discharged  
a shaft with fatal aim. The waves rolled the dead body of  
Orion to the land, and bewailing her fatal error with many  
tears, Diana placed him among the stars, where he appears  
as a giant, with a girdle, sword, lion's skin, and  
club. Sirius, his dog, follows him, and the Pleiads fly  
before him.

\[ Bulfinch's Mythology, by Thomas Bulfinch ]
